title: symeig fails for 129x129 cuda matrix with CUBLAS memory mapping error
body_html:
symeig fails with 'CUBLAS error: memory mapping error (11) in magma_ssytrd2_gpu' for any cuda matrix larger than 128x128.

Repro steps:

import torch

for size in [128, 129]:
    print('generating random symmetric matrix {0:}x{0:} on gpu'.format(size))
    a = torch.randn(size, size)
    cov = torch.mm(a, a.transpose(1,0))
    tcov = torch.Tensor(cov).cuda()
    print('computing symmetric eigenvectors')
    teigval, teigvec = torch.symeig(tcov, eigenvectors=True)
    print('first 5 eigenvals')
    print(teigval[None,:5])
    print('---')

Output:

generating random symmetric matrix 128x128 on gpu
computing symmetric eigenvectors
first 5 eigenvals
 0.0004  0.0364  0.1143  0.2193  0.3734
[torch.cuda.FloatTensor of size 1x5 (GPU 0)]

---
generating random symmetric matrix 129x129 on gpu
computing symmetric eigenvectors
CUBLAS error: memory mapping error (11) in magma_ssytrd2_gpu at /data/users/soumith/miniconda2/conda-bld/magma-cuda80-2.1.0_1476154064021/work/magma-2.1.0/src/ssytrd2_gpu.cpp:280
CUBLAS error: memory mapping error (11) in magma_ssytrd2_gpu at /data/users/soumith/miniconda2/conda-bld/magma-cuda80-2.1.0_1476154064021/work/magma-2.1.0/src/ssytrd2_gpu.cpp:285
first 5 eigenvals
 0  0  0  0  0
[torch.cuda.FloatTensor of size 1x5 (GPU 0)]

Using recent build of pytorch (pulled Oct 25) w/ cuda8, titan xp.

body:
symeig fails with 'CUBLAS error: memory mapping error (11) in magma_ssytrd2_gpu' for any cuda matrix larger than 128x128.

Repro steps:

```
import torch

for size in [128, 129]:
    print('generating random symmetric matrix {0:}x{0:} on gpu'.format(size))
    a = torch.randn(size, size)
    cov = torch.mm(a, a.transpose(1,0))
    tcov = torch.Tensor(cov).cuda()
    print('computing symmetric eigenvectors')
    teigval, teigvec = torch.symeig(tcov, eigenvectors=True)
    print('first 5 eigenvals')
    print(teigval[None,:5])
    print('---')
```

Output:
```
generating random symmetric matrix 128x128 on gpu
computing symmetric eigenvectors
first 5 eigenvals
 0.0004  0.0364  0.1143  0.2193  0.3734
[torch.cuda.FloatTensor of size 1x5 (GPU 0)]

---
generating random symmetric matrix 129x129 on gpu
computing symmetric eigenvectors
CUBLAS error: memory mapping error (11) in magma_ssytrd2_gpu at /data/users/soumith/miniconda2/conda-bld/magma-cuda80-2.1.0_1476154064021/work/magma-2.1.0/src/ssytrd2_gpu.cpp:280
CUBLAS error: memory mapping error (11) in magma_ssytrd2_gpu at /data/users/soumith/miniconda2/conda-bld/magma-cuda80-2.1.0_1476154064021/work/magma-2.1.0/src/ssytrd2_gpu.cpp:285
first 5 eigenvals
 0  0  0  0  0
[torch.cuda.FloatTensor of size 1x5 (GPU 0)]
```

Using recent build of pytorch (pulled Oct 25) w/ cuda8, titan xp.
